channel.title: Comments on: Goodbye Google Reader, hello feedly
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SeanJA
item.dc:creator: SeanJA
item.description: I have gone with tiny-tiny-rss, which is open source. I have installed it on my own server, added a twitter plugin, added mark as unread/read functionality to the right-click menu. I really like it so far, but it could use some caching though.
item.content:encoded: I have gone with tiny-tiny-rss, which is open source. I have installed it on my own server, added a twitter plugin, added mark as unread/read functionality to the right-click menu. I really like it so far, but it could use some caching though.

item.title: By: Kevin Devine
item.dc:creator: Kevin Devine
item.description: I found http://bazqux.com/ and it is a really nice Google Reader clone. No starred items, but I can save to ReadItLater or Instapaper. It has Readability built-in and also imports comments from compatible blogs. It could use some features, but it is really nice. It does have a cost, the developer asks for an annual fee (minimum $9)
item.content:encoded: I found http://bazqux.com/ and it is a really nice Google Reader clone. No starred items, but I can save to ReadItLater or Instapaper. It has Readability built-in and also imports comments from compatible blogs. It could use some features, but it is really nice. It does have a cost, the developer asks for an annual fee (minimum $9)

item.title: By: Mohamed El-Beltagy
item.dc:creator: Mohamed El-Beltagy
item.content:encoded:
Check out NetVibes. It’s wonderful:
http://www.netvibes.com/en

I liked it more than feedly.

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: I am checking out feedly this weekend. My new 'droid also shipped with Flipboard, which looks interesting but graphic-heavy. RIP Reader :(
item.content:encoded: I am checking out feedly this weekend. My new ‘droid also shipped with Flipboard, which looks interesting but graphic-heavy. RIP Reader üôÅ

item.title: By: remou
item.dc:creator: remou
item.description: @Sandarenu well, well. I must have an out-of-date attitude :) Thanks.
item.content:encoded: @Sandarenu well, well. I must have an out-of-date attitude üôÇ Thanks.

item.title: By: Sandarenu
item.dc:creator: Sandarenu
item.content:encoded:
I also started using Feedly.

@remou: FeedDemon has announced that they are going to stop development on that as well. http://nick.typepad.com/blog/2013/03/the-end-of-feeddemon.html

item.title: By: remou
item.dc:creator: remou
item.description: I still think I prefer FeedDemon, I like the layout better and the ability to set notifications for the various feeds is quite nice. I am not mad about the ads, but I guess I can get the pro version if the annoy me too much.
item.content:encoded: I still think I prefer FeedDemon, I like the layout better and the ability to set notifications for the various feeds is quite nice. I am not mad about the ads, but I guess I can get the pro version if the annoy me too much.
